text:
All comments when you complete the game:

1) Government ending (worst one)
‚ÄúThank you for playing‚Äù

2) Suzu and grandpa ending
Suzu: ‚ÄúIf only everyone had survived‚Äù

3) Civilians ending
‚ÄúCongratulations‚Äù

4) Kurou ending 
Tesshin : ‚ÄúI wished We had more elite swordsmen‚Äù

5) Akadama Clan ending
Kitcho : ‚ÄúSo, the Akadama Clan wasn‚Äôt strong enough to resist the government?!‚Äù

6) Samurai allegiance ending (best one)
‚ÄúCONGRATULATIONS‚Äù

As for the Struggle.. don't you feel it? The world is terrifying.

author: bushwhacker2k

text:
I'm getting annoyed by this. First and foremost, Way of the Samurai is a work of FICTION. It's not supposed to be taken seriously.

Second, Don took up the sword and enployed more than just skill and technique to his fighting. He fought with passion and cared deeply for Suzu and Kurikichi, the down-trodden and innocent. I think it is because of his passion that he was a true samurai.
author: ShaDHP23

text: Wait!!! In the Meiji period Samurai class was in chaos so near to it's end that anyone also without great ancient family member could say him a "samurai",  I'm with you when you say that a black guy couldn't become a samurai, but just because i never heard of black immigration in Japan ^^
author: TheAtlius

text: I doubt this game is that serious, it's probably not a historical thing. I mean even IF a black guy went to Japan back then, he wouldn't be a samurai, you don't just have a sword and say you're a samurai, it's more complicated than that.
author: bushwhacker2k

text: bushwhacker2k Wrong. There was an actual Black Samurai living in Japan centuries ago.

text:
You can feel the undertones of Tenchu just in the music.

Aquire has often made clunky, budget-like games that have interesting depth and enjoyment to them.
